p: All studied soil variables showed a significant difference among the habitats of A. ochroleuca, except the pH ( Table 2). The soil of abandoned fields had the highest values of silt (44.20%), clay (15.30%), EC (0.80 dS/m), OM (1.18%), Na (1.36 meq/L), K (0.41 meq/L), Ca (5.50 meq/L), Mg (0.90 meq/L), SO 4 (4.45 meq/l), total N (1015.40 mg/kg), available N (31.38 mg/kg), total P (982.47 mg/kg), and available P (8.88 mg/kg), but this habitat had the lowest content of sand (40.5%) ( Table 2).
